info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 05 at 10:01AM EDT until September 07 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg SC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Carolina... French Broad River At Blantyre affecting Henderson and Transylvania Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO WEDNESDAY EVENING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...French Broad River At Blantyre. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Minor Flooding begins. Farmland flooding occurs on both sides of the French Broad River. Floodwaters begin to impact boat access areas at Grove Bridge Road and Crab Creek Road. At 17.0 feet, Minor Flooding continues to inundate farmland and begins to inundate shoulders of River Road near the Big Willow Road intersection. At 18.0 feet, Minor Flooding continues. Widespread farmland flooding between the French Broad River and the old railroad bed is ongoing. The river may overtop the old railroad bed near Fodderstack Mountain Rd. and River Ridge Rd. The intersection of River Rd. and Big Willow Rd. is inundated with several inches of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EDT Monday the stage was 14.7 feet. - The river is steadily rising from recent heavy rainfall. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above the flood stage of 16 feet this afternoon, and crest near 18.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday morning and below the action stage of 15 feet late Wednesday. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement should be issued late this evening before 11 pm EDT.
